page.title: 15Growing Thatch Straw
page.content: There are many thatched cottages in Thurleigh and one of the local farmers grows wheat straw especially for thatching. The straw is specially harvested and is left long, some 2 or 3ft in length so it can be used for thatching. Modern combining methods would leave the straw too short to be of any value to a thatcher. In order to keep the straw to the necessary length, an old fashioned binder is used to cut the wheat. It is then either put into a thresher drum or combed in a similar way to wool. The end result is combed wheat reed, which is then neatly bundled, ready for use. Thatching and growing the materials is a thriving business and not as may be thought a thing of the past.
